website_summaries.verdict: A well-made harness that is a good choice if you don't want one that's too rugged or expensive for your needs.
pros: Stands out for its quick-release buckles that make it easy to put on and take off
Has adjustable fit and chest padding for added comfort
cons: The harness might slip to the side on some active dogs
Not safe for securing your dog in the car

website_summaries.verdict: Aside from 2 strategically positioned D rings, this harness also comes with a short leash that doubles as a seat belt. A premium no-pull harness from an industry leader.
pros: 2 D rings provide fantastic versatility: shoulder connector is ideal for light pullers while the front D ring offers extra control for serious tuggers
Quick-release buckles make it easy to put on and remove
5 adjustment points make it easier to achieve a proper fit
cons: Padded chest plate adds weight and bulk
Might not be the best fit for smaller dogs

customer_reviews.title: Walking is fun again!
customer_reviews.text: Day 1. I attached this to my monster 130 pound Rottweiler. We proceeded to embark (pun intended) on our best walk in years. We came across other dogs, squirrels, and mailmen. None were devoured and my arms remain comfortably in their sockets. Not only was pulling nearly impossible for him, this harness also forced the beast to stay pretty close to my side instead of lagging behind or lunging ahead, Quality seems good but we'll see how this holds up in another month or two.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Failed strength test. Not crash tested.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the advertising. These harnesses were not crash tested. They failed the initial strength test and did not make it to crash test. Took a lot of research to find out. Bought 5 of these for all of my dogs. Only useful as a walking harness. I should have done more research first. You can find the results at Consumerreports.org
customer_reviews.author: USAF Veteran

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend. The stitching on the interior was sharp in several places, I cant imagine that being comfortable on my dog's skin! Lots of plastic, connectors at weird places, nothing soft or comfortable looking, when my husband saw it he thought it looked like a torture device. There are several points of adjustment, but not on length which is what I was looking for. Also didnt realize that the return was not free, so that was a bit frustrating as well. Overall, would not recommend - look elsewhere for your pup!
customer_reviews.author: A.W.

customer_reviews.title: HARNESS BROKE AND PUT MY DOG IN EXTREME DANGER
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to the Kurgo dog harness, my dog almost died today. We've been reasonably happy with the harness, until today, when the front latch pulled off of the harness and allowed our 1.5 year old Australian Shepherd to run free. Thank goodness we caught him, but it was very dangerous. I'll be buying a replacement harness from somewhere else, and frankly, Kurgo should reach out and offer a refund, or more. We used the harness only for a year.
customer_reviews.author: Dazzle

customer_reviews.title: Kurgo blocks you from reselling your harness here on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Our dog greatly dislikes this harness, much more than her other harness. (You can see her looking greatly uncomfortable in the photo.) Unfortunately we were slow to get around to returning, so now we're stuck with it. Kurgo has specifically worked with Amazon to block reselling this harness here on Amazon for the typical seller. Really shady business move to get folks to buy your product new, and it makes me sad that Amazon supports this anti-consumer behavior. That together with this being a harness our dog greatly dislikes, I give it 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Picture isn’t what you get!
customer_reviews.text: I tried to like it. The buckles in the picture are not the ones on the harness they are new and “improved “. What they are is impossible to put on and remove quickly. It is now a a metal piece you fit through like a toggle. Your dog must be very still you must have the fine motor skills of a surgeon and the patience of a saint. CHANGE THE PICTURE TO MATCH THE PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Karyna

customer_reviews.title: Crash tested but not designed for comfort or convenience.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's crash tested but I've had a couple problems. First it's difficult to deal with the closures, they don't want to open, they don't want to buckle and that increases the time it takes me to get them on and off, so they're inconvenient to use. Secondly, I had a 10-hour drive yesterday with 2 dogs in their harnesses and attached to the kurgo zip line and my smaller dog lost hair over her shoulder where the harness goes. I selected the size the fits her weight and measurements but she either needs a wider strap or softer material. I'm sure if I were to continue using that harness on her she'd get a sore eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The updated design of this product does not match the quality of the previous Kurgo. The front snap continues to come undone which results in the harness not staying in place during walks. Throwing this one away and ordering a replacement Kurgo without the fast release clips. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: G.P. Searle

customer_reviews.title: ... corgi because other corgi owners said it was a good harness for them
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my corgi because other corgi owners said it was a good harness for them. Problem with a front led harness and a corgi is that the leash is either pulled up against their face or it's dragging on the ground getting tangled in their feet. There isn't much room for slack to hang on a leash when your dog is about 10 inches tall. Also, the adjustable buckles didn't stay in position for me. They ended up loosening up and my dog slipped out of his harness. Luckily I caught him before he could get to a busy Chicago street. Looking for suggestions if anyone else has a corgi and found a harness they like!
customer_reviews.author: gtothew

customer_reviews.title: Car wreck tested
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for road trips and highway driving to keep my dog safe. Hadn't planned on using it for short trips around town. However, we were unfortunately t-boned by a car going very fast through a stop sign. My dog was in the backseat, buckled into the middle buckle. We were hit very hard. Had she not been buckled in, she would've gone flying across the backseat and hit the passenger door. She could've been seriously physically hurt and mentally traumatized. Instead, she was 100% fine and just as excited to go on the next car ride as ever. I will never take my dog in the car without one again. Ever.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Front 'No Pull' Dosen't Work
customer_reviews.text: Arrived yesterday. Very disappointed that when hooked in the front the whole harness moves to the side when turning. The fit is not stable. The fabric is stiff and seems uncomfortable for my dog. He refused to walk with it. So it is going back. Amazon asked $5.99 for a shipping charge. Very surprised and called customer service who sent a shipping label. Now back to square one. Not sure what to buy.
customer_reviews.author: VictoriaS

customer_reviews.title: Miserable Experience
customer_reviews.text: Awful product. Very difficult to size to our dog. Also next to impossible to put on or off our dog (25 pound golden doodle puppy). The metal buckles that wrap around to dogs chest are very difficult to connect or disconnect. Once in the car and the seat belt is attached to the harness per the product instructions, the dog cannot move. All he can do is sit, not lie down, not move......he can only sit. We will find another method to make him safe. This is not the one.
customer_reviews.author: P. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Ripped on First Use
customer_reviews.text: If your dog is a puller the build quality of this harness does not seem to hold up. The chest ring ripped out on the very first walk. My Ruffwear harness has seen over 6 months of use and is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Pavel F

customer_reviews.title: Not escape proof
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is a husky, known for escaping any situation. He's really good at getting out of things, into things, and generally with a lot of energy. We've tried So many harnesses and this one is *okay* He's escaped so many times from this one. The way his body is and the harness placement makes it real easy for him to turn around, scrunch his body, and slide out. We've spent many a days chasing our husky around the streets as hes just a puppy without proper training as of yet and seems to think its a game. Still looking for a harness to keep him safe in the mean time
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Well built; be careful when choosing size.
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be very well made and is probably a great product. However, I followed the instructions provided to measure my dog and ordered a medium accordingly. Unfortunately, my dog measured close to the maximum size for the medium and close to the minimum size for the large. I went with the medium thinking it would fit; it didn't. I am returning the medium and will likely order a large as a replacement. I like that this product is actually tested, the build quality seems very good, and the price is right. I wish it would have fit; but I'll try again and update this review once we get one we can actually use.
customer_reviews.author: William J. SnyderTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Designed and sold by USA Company - High Quality Harness that is Built to Last
customer_reviews.text: When you search Amazon for a dog harness, there is a an overwhelming number of "Private Label" products sold by offshore sellers who merely make up a brand name and apply that to a low-quality harness in an effort to make a quick buck. The telltale sign is that the Amazon'product detail page, packaging and instructions appear to be written by someone unfamiliar with the English language. These sellers could care less about their brand and reputation. I sought out a USA seller and Kurgo exceeded my expectations. The harness is well-built and has a lifetime warranty. I would be even more delighted with it if it were made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta

customer_reviews.title: This product actually works
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my very stubborn Pitbull who likes to pull so hard that he has on several occasions dislocated my shoulder and left bruises on my hand from the leash, I have tried Martingales, and gentle leaders, and nothing has worked until now, this morning we came across his Achilles heel, a stray cat, he tried to take off after this cat and he only got so far before he figured out it wasn't going to work and it was a lot less tension on my shoulder and hand. I haven't tried the seatbelt clip yet but he has car issues and after reading the reviews about someone else's dog flying forward I don't think I will.
customer_reviews.author: Spidergirl

customer_reviews.title: Leash Ring On Front Coming Off in Just 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product 3 months ago. I generally liked the harness but tonight I noticed that the ring where the leash attached has all but pulled off the webbing holding it (only a few threads left to cut through. My dog likes to pull but is only 40 pounds. The design of the attachment ring is such that it cuts through the webbing holding it. It is a horrible design. Additionally the adjustable straps won't stay put so you have to keep re-adjusting them. This is a more minor nuisance although maybe with some dogs they could get loose. But the front ring cutting through the webbing attaching it I consider a serious safety defect.
customer_reviews.author: KarlG

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY NO PULLS!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, finally an easy to put on harness. This was a good start I thought. It wasn't until we walked that I really appreciated it. My Irish Setter puppy pulls, and she can almost knock a 250 pound man over. It is wearing on anyone's nerves. This is the first time she didn't pull once! We were in the woods for miles, she didn't pull, was much more obedient, what a pleasure. The only negative is she has to relearn the command "come back now". That's for when she runs off around trees, over branches. With the command she could retrace every step back to me. She will relearn it fast enough. GREAT product recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jk

customer_reviews.title: This works for pulling
customer_reviews.text: I have tried all kind of different collars for my dogs who are both heavy pullers. I had been using pinch collars as they were the only ones that had worked at all, so I was very dubious about the D ring working, but decided to try it. It WORKS great. Both my dogs hardly pull at all using this harness and it works to seatbelt them in the car also. So glad I tried it. That being said, I ordered a different brand for my female because she is a hound mix with a narrow head and neck and large chest. This harness did not adjust enough to fit her neck. So, measure carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Lauriejg

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the durability
customer_reviews.text: Very dissatisfied. Was a great harness. Paired up with a seat belt clip. Was perfect for my husky. But today while I was at work and had to go inside building. I tied him to a post in front of door. He got excited when I stepped back into line of site and pulled toward me. And the nylon strap on the neck portion broke! He’s still a puppy at almost 11 months. He’s big, but not that big. I woulf expect a product like this to last much longer than a single month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: My golden retriever Winston has proved that this is a very durable and chew proof product. We've been using this product for about two months with him, he's still being leash trained so he pulls a lot, this harness has stayed completely in tact and hasn't unbuckled or unclipped once...it's also chew proof as Winston tries to chew it off of him if we don't remove it and he's in the house and bored. So much better than any other product we've tried for him, it's great for the car and provides extra padding for when he pulls so he doesn't choke himself. 10/10 recommend
customer_reviews.author: Chris k

customer_reviews.title: Great for dachshunds who pull
customer_reviews.text: This is the only harness that works for my dachshund who gets so excited on walks she just pulls the entire time. I have tried all the specialized harnesses for the breed, but because of her leg-to-chest ratio, they either don't fit properly or the buckles lay under her arms and cause major chaffing and rashes. Its also just a very discreet and sleek harness that's pretty secure. I hesitate to give it a full five stars simply because if you have a MAJOR puller, it will eventually get looser over time as it stretches out (not the adjustment of the straps - the actual material).
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Did not pass crash test
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was getting a safe product for a foster dog. This harness appears well made and has metal buckles. It's not hard to buckle, and looks very nice. Then I saw a video of crash tests done on several dog harnesses that claim they protect your dog in the car while researching for two rescue pups. I was horrified that the harness we spent extra money on failed, breaking in the crash test. If you value the lives of the passengers in your car and value your dog's life, do not get this harness. Spend the money to make sure you are all safe or don't put your pet in the vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: S. Unruh

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy your walks now with this No PULL Harness!
customer_reviews.text: We have been working with our dog to stop him from pulling on a leash for months. We have used a prong collar, a vibrating collar and treats with little or no progress. After doing another web search for help we came across a you tube video using a harness that fastens in the front. So, we looked on Amazon and found Kurgo Tru-Fit. We tried it out as soon as we could get it adjusted which took several fittings and adjustments. Then we began our walk. It has worked beautifully! He whined a bit at first but gave in to it and now we are having enjoyable walks. Wish we had found this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Reesie1

customer_reviews.title: Great Harness
customer_reviews.text: This harness has been super awesome. I went on 12 mile hike with my dog, and at the top of the hike my dog injured his paw. I hooked a leash to his harness and put the leash around my neck to create a sling to support my dogs weight. The harness relieved my arms, making it possible to carry him for much longer periods of time. It was a life saver. It would have taken me another day to carry him down the trail without it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Ellsworth

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful company but this harness doesn't fit all dogs
customer_reviews.text: Kurgo has amazing customer support and this is surely a great harness. They've helped me work out that it just won't fit my dog. (Her neck size is small, chest is medium.) I'm rating it low because I hope they will design a strap system that is more adjustable or let's you swap out straps between these two sizes. I'm donating my harness to a rescue org.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: I really want to like this harness
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this harness, but the medium seem a little too large for my 24 pound dog and now it's too late to return/exchange. My girl wiggles out of the harness and it's set to the smallest size. It also twists around her torso. The belly band isn't able to move on the strap because of a buckle. Oh well, we tried. ***Edit 3/1/2019. Will be looking for something else. This one just doesn't work for us at all. She gets sore spots from the metal buckles rubbing her body.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: unfortunately, this one was kind of not awesome. my dog is a bit of a spaz if he sees other dogs during our drive... and the harness just couldn’t keep up with him. Several times he got tangled up with it and the seatbelt; and honestly, it seemed like it could’ve done damage to him. I pulled off the side of the road just to get him resituated. I’m not sure what’s worse, leaving him in it or out of it. Neddless to say, we returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna Starr

customer_reviews.title: Not good for a large dog that pulls when you walk
customer_reviews.text: Remarkably disappointing. No matter how well I fit it it still rotates If I attach the leash in front and she pulls when we walk. I have a harness at half the price I bought from PetSmart that fits perfectly and stays in place if I attach it in front even when she pulls. I’m sure it’s great for harnessing her in the car, but for walks and attaching a leash in front it’s just not a good solution. It advertised as good for both walks and car rides, but it’s just not if your dog pulls.
customer_reviews.author: The Comic Whisperer

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect sizing listed
customer_reviews.text: The sizing measurements are wayyy off. According to their measurements my girl could fit the large as she was at the lowest point of the sizing scale plus they have the large listed as for Labrador. It was way too big, so I returned it for the medium and even at the tightest adjustment it is still too big. Ended up keeping it because I didn’t want to return it again but it was definitely a waste of money. They need to update their measurements, and label the harness correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rating for Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The harness itself is extremely durable, made of top-notch quality materials, and I can see why there's a lifetime warranty on it. Unfortunately, my dog had an allergic reaction to the chest plate. I called Customer Service and the rep, Thomas, was extremely kind and understanding of the issue and gave me a new product free of charge including shipping. Excellent customer service and products are rare these days. This alone makes me a lifetime Kurgo customer.
customer_reviews.author: Xen8

customer_reviews.title: Control of the Big Darling at last!
customer_reviews.text: I use the KURGO for my German Shepherd/Collie dog 45 lbs. All forms of dog control related to walking and running are easier now. I am also pleased that my dog is not being strangled if she suddenly decided to run at a wild animal or some other distraction. Sometimes she decides to go on strike and lie down in amost inconvenient place. I am able to lift her easily onto all fours and she is ready to go. I recommend this to everyone that has a dog - small or large. I keep it on my dog all the time (and attach lead when needed).
customer_reviews.author: Juliet Sierra

customer_reviews.title: I like your harness
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I like your harness. More importantly, my dog likes your harness. His old harness was thick leather with steel hardware and when I'd get it he would run and hide in the closet. When I made him come out he would come over and put his nose on the floor or his head against the chair to keep it from going over his head. With the Kurgo he comes running. Suggestion: Stitch the strap that goes from the neck to the back to the short strip that fastens around the body. It can turn upside down and get tangled and then the plastic buckles don't match up. That's it. Diego likes his harness.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick T. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this harness for a 24 lb Jack Russel Terrier Mix who was hard to fit.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the multiple adjustments, for this small dog, small head , small neck and barrel chest. Tried three harnesses before this one that finally worked.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lawton

customer_reviews.title: Great Company!  Wish it would work for my dog.
customer_reviews.text: We want our 9 lb chihuahua to be safe in his car seat. We tried size medium, which was too big. The small barely just fits around his weird barrel chest, but pulls and the metal rubs against him. He HATES it! All the metal makes it very heavy for a tiny dog. I think this should be advertised for medium and large dogs only. We are using the tether to at least keep him attached to the seat belt, just with his regular vest halter - which we know is probably not safe. The company has EXCELLENT customer service. I was so impressed. I asked about sizing and they replied ther next day.
customer_reviews.author: Jenlou

customer_reviews.title: Not big enough for giant breeds
customer_reviews.text: If I had smaller dogs, these would be 5-stars. They are only big enough for my smallest Tibetan Mastiffs, and it is tight/just barely works when my little ones (105 lbs) are in full winter coat. Definitely does not work on my 140-lb avg sized adult. These kids will chew up anything, so we make certain they are put up when not in use. Very easy to put on/remove. Allows for good movement while safely restrained on car trips. Wish they were available in a larger size
customer_reviews.author: S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Big difference in quality with the different colors.
customer_reviews.text: We had previously purchased the same harness in black and LOVED it. Our Cassie is an escape artist and should could not do so in this harness when patched on her chest. This harness in blue is completely different in fit. Where the small fit her well in black it was wayyy too small in blue. When I ordered the medium it still does not fit well. And the snaps look and feel a bit cheaper than on the black. It’s interesting how a change in color has so many differences. Next time we will stick to the black one.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Music-Stepp

customer_reviews.title: Not for furry dogs
customer_reviews.text: Had really high hopes for this harness, but it simply doesn’t fit my dog. The chest straps have buckles which work very well, but the neck straps do not. On the Kurgo website they show someone putting the harness over a dogs neck and casually tightening the neck straps. This is impossible with the harness I received. I’m a medium sized, moderately fit man, and the amount of force it takes to tighten these straps is crazy. There is no way I could do this without strangling my dog.
customer_reviews.author: RandomPerson42

customer_reviews.title: Love this harness!
customer_reviews.text: Love this harness! Well worth the money! It’s super adjustable and my pomsky is an odd size so this fit her perfectly! She hasn’t chewed through this harness and she constantly chews on other collars and harnesses. There’s a slight learning curve to learning how to put it on but it ends up being a really easy and secure system. It’s a little on the heavier side but overall great product!
customer_reviews.author: Liliana Bello

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic harness
customer_reviews.text: I really don’t know how many harnesses I’ve gotten... I really like the yuppie harness but it broke repeatedly. This harness is sturdy, easy to use and put on especially with a Wriggling dog. The front Tuck works very well for getting them not to pull and the Back hook works really well. I’ve never use the seatbelt for my dogs before but I tried it with this one and I was really pleased. My dog gets very anxious about traveling calmed right down. This is something I have no hesitation recommending and give a good rating - It seems to deserve all five stars
customer_reviews.author: A Kamberelis

customer_reviews.title: It can be difficult to put on.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these, one in medium and one in large. As seatbelt harness, they work very well. My only complaint is that one of them is very difficult to get on. One of the little silver buckles is very difficult to get through the hole provided. I always think, when I am struggling with it, that I’m going to file it down a little bit to make it a little bit smaller. When I pick them up from daycare, they can never get it on, I always have to do it.
customer_reviews.author: DJF

customer_reviews.title: My dog ripped it right off!
customer_reviews.text: My 36 pound labradoodle ripped the harness right off on a walk and took off down a busy city street. The nylon just split right out--see pictures. Thankfully, no cars appeared and she eventually returned, but it was a terrifying moment. If my small/medium dog can do this then they really have no business selling this product for bigger and stronger dogs. Please, for your dog's sake, consider spending more money on a more durable and higher rated product. That's certainly what I'm doing now.
customer_reviews.author: joeh545

customer_reviews.title: Works, but not the best
customer_reviews.text: This harness helped a lot with our dog who pulls too much on his leash, so that was good. I don't love how the straps rub at his armpits, though (he's already gotten a cut on one from this harness), especially when using the front D-ring. The seatbelt attachment is kind of odd; the hook doesn't spin so if your dog does anything but sit still, he'll get wrapped up in the seatbelt cord and harness. I have to clip the seatbelt hook to his leash clip to make it work. I'm shopping around for another harness for my dog that won't rub away at his tender armpit skin. This will be our backup harness.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Woof!
customer_reviews.text: I love these harnesses. My dog grew out of the small by just an inch or 2 so I ordered a medium just recently. I was a little worried at 1st because the quality seemed better than the 1st one and I thought maybe I got a counterfeit the 1st time around. They are slightly different from the small size in the way they're made but maybe they've just updated the product. Regardless, it was just as simple as the 1st time I bought 1, the quality is impeccable and my dog seems very comfortable in it; you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Stevee G

customer_reviews.title: mostly excellent
customer_reviews.text: The harness is great. The designers seem to have thought of everything; lots of adjustment points, heavy-duty hardware, construction, materials--but believe me, the seat buckle attachment is a waste. It's short, can't be adjusted, and the latch for the carabiner is cheapo wire. It came off the first time we used it, leaving the dog to start making a play for the front seat while I was driving. The carabiner FEELS heavy at first and you don't notice how cheap the latch is. If you really want this particular belt extension, go to a sporting goods store and get a real carabiner. There is one other down side--the nylon material can and does chafe her a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Pearlgearl

customer_reviews.title: great heavy duty harness for the car!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well in the car! holds him in place and has helped save him from falling the crack between the back seat and front seat. its pretty heavy duty and i think would probably work well in an accident. I let the leash be a little long sometimes so he can walk around the back but it can be shortened and it keeps him sitting down. For reference, I got the LARGE harness for a 38 lb shar pei and use it in a toyota corolla 2008 and also use the exenstion you can buy in addition to this harness (sold by same company).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My go-to harness
customer_reviews.text: This harness is the best one I've used out of many. Easy to slip on and take off. The front clip attachment has been working great while leash training. Lot's of adjust-ability for the head opening and the chest. The snap that holds the chest strap in place tends to come undone once and awhile but other than that it's a great harness. I use it daily for walking, playing catch with a long leash, securing in the car, and leash training and it's holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: msp1

customer_reviews.title: It's workable
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok harness. The chest pad comes up a bit high and sits against my dog's throat, which I really don't like. I also had to change the loop that is meant to attach to a leash, which was made of a fairly flimsy plastic. I put a locking metal C ring on there instead, which seems to do the trick and feels much more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Favorite harness
customer_reviews.text: My favorite harness on the market. We bought this to replace another one of the same model we bought 5 years ago. We leave it on her when she’s swimming on hikes etc, and she has whipped through many a thicket on horse trails in it, so over time the first one frayed and wore out, but is actually still usable. We love it because it dries relatively quickly and the buckles are the only ones we’ve found on the market that are crash-rated, so it’s great to use with a dog seatbelt.
customer_reviews.author: beat soul

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is way off
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my German Shepherds and according to the sizing I purchased ex-large. I think I can make them work as we’re leaving on a 14 hr. road trip in a few days but really they are too big and I’m concerned about the safety of my dogs. The worst part is, if you attach a leash to the front of the harness to the no pull hook it’s pulls the entire front of the harness sideways so basically useless. I wish I could return them for a large.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Hedges

customer_reviews.title: Just out of the return window.....
customer_reviews.text: We loved this harness at first. My husband just sent me a photo and said the harness is tearing. We have a 50lb husky and she by no means is an aggressive puller. Unfortunately, we’ve had it since June 6 and are out of the return window. I’m hoping this review catches attention and can help get this resolved. This harness was way too expensive to only last EXACTLY one month.... my husband Is so thankful he caught the tearing before taking our dog on a walk because she would’ve easily broke through and ran away!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra James

customer_reviews.title: VERY HAPPY WITH THIS HARNESS 👍
customer_reviews.text: I researched A LOT of walking harnesses due to having used one that chafed my dog behind her front legs to the point of breaking the skin. I finally settled on this Kurgo harness, based on pictures, reviews, and price. I am very happy with my decision! I have a medium size dog (35-40 pounds) and purchased a medium size harness, which is perfect. I use the loop on top of the harness (versus the loop on the chest) when walking with Bella, which she prefers, since she likes to lead the way versus walking beside me. Highly recommended - and I’d be happy to answer questions.
customer_reviews.author: Suzan B.

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy material.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 4-month old Boxer puppy. She is 6-months old now (42 lbs) and the size medium harness is still adjusting right along with her. It's not bulky or heavy but is made of very durable material. I feel she is safe and secure in it. I use the seat belt strap as a short leash and it works great to control my very energetic dog inside the vehicle. When she outgrows this one, I'll probably buy the same brand/style again.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Black

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Great quality and comfortable for the dog! Love this harness!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this harness! It’s such good quality! The snaps are sturdy, plastic but sturdy, the harness does not rub in any weird places so it fits him comfortably. It has a place to attach the leash in the back or front to prevent pulling, easy to put on. Lightweight but quality material, and even comes with the car strap. I accidentally left it on his kennel and he chewed up the first one I bought last year. I loved it so much I had to replace it with the exact same one so I bought it again!
customer_reviews.author: MonMon16

customer_reviews.title: REALLY NICE
customer_reviews.text: i was shocked how nicely made this was and sturdy for the price. It's so easy to put it over my dogs head strap from under the belly to lock in up top. You don't have to wrangle them to get their legs in the loops like most. Super easy. Looks good too. There are two hooks. One up top and one in the front. I'm very happy. My dog has gone on more walks now because it's so easy to put on.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Stone

customer_reviews.title: Okay but not great
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great harness however my main complaint and the reason I’m not giving a full five stars is because the button clasp on the bottom chest part of the harness no longer secures after about six months of use. This means the harness is always lopsided on my pup and probably not as secure when used in the car. I really wish the would improve this one feature and I think it would be a much better harness.
customer_reviews.author: Funkymonkey

customer_reviews.title: Faulty snap button, otherwise fine
customer_reviews.text: We got this harness because our dog outgrew the previous one, same model same brand. We loved it and had no issues with it (other than some slight stretching but that’s to be expected). This harness seems to have a “glitch” where the snap button in the underbelly section just won’t stay in place. Not sure if it’s an issue with all the mediums or only the grey models, or just our specific harness.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: My dog got injured because of this harness
customer_reviews.text: Terrible fitting harness. My dog slipped out of it twice. I should've known it was bad the first time. But he slipped right out of it AGAIN and now I'm at the vet because he got injured when he slipped out of it. The thing was tightened exactly as the instructions say, wasn't loose at all. The harness is just bad. The clasps just don't keep it tight and leave lots of wiggle room. Can't believe I trusted the safety of my dog to this bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Radland

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic dog product
customer_reviews.text: My Malinois is a tough dog. She ate the first harness right off of her. Now this bad ass product, on the other hand, has quality. Serious quality, great materials. Stitching much like I see in mountaineering equipment. Came with a detachable carabiner strap for seat-belt use. The harness is fully adjustable with separate chest width/ height button attachments for the side straps, which I might add have TWO detach points for super easy, near effortless placement on the dog. I really, really like this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt.Elliott

customer_reviews.title: it's been a good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Harness definitely helps mitigate my dog's pulling. She will start to tug and quickly stops if she's not overly excited about whatever object that catches her attention. When she is overly excited, she will continue to tug, but not as forcefully. The problem is that the harness will pull to the side and rub against her front leg. Another issue we ran into is that there is no buckle for the portion that wraps around her neck. It's sometimes difficult to put on and pull off. Overall, it's been a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: VBD

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit my 11 pound dog too well.
customer_reviews.text: The quality and construction is very good but it didn't fit my dog very well. But that had more to do with the shape of my dog than the harness. On my dog, the front pad tended to bunch up and my dog would stick a front paw through it. It works well if your dog pulls forward. But if the dog pulls backwards, this harness does very little to restrain the dog securely.
customer_reviews.author: PY

customer_reviews.title: I really want to love this harness, but...
customer_reviews.text: This harness is very well constructed and durable. And I really want to love this harness, but... My problem with it is that the straps keep slipping and loosening up which has allowed my dog to escape from it twice in two days. And with it loosening up, then she tries to chew on the chest piece. Plus my 7 month old pup has an over-abundance of loose skin, which makes it easy for her to flip her body around in the harness. sadly, this harness does not eork for us
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Clements

customer_reviews.title: Not True To Size
customer_reviews.text: This harness is not true to size. The neck and girth listed for the size I ordered matched my dog. However, when the harness arrived it is super tiny and says it fits only up to 25 lbs. This is way too small for a dog with a 12-20 in neck as stated.
customer_reviews.author: jessiesmom

customer_reviews.title: Once I wanted to be sure she would be comfortable in and that had great construction and the Kurgo ...
customer_reviews.text: I looked for a suitable harness for my dog. Once I wanted to be sure she would be comfortable in and that had great construction and the Kurgo Tru-Fit was perfect. She didn't mind the losing the collar and being fitted with this harness. I have not yet taken her for a walk because I wanted her to get used the the harness. I would recommed this harness to any owner of a dog around 80 lbs. The only problem is that they do not have a choice of colors. I almost bought a purple one from another buyer but the Tru-Fit was made so much better. Hopefull y Kurgo will offer colors in the futires.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M. Gray

customer_reviews.title: The front lead does not work
customer_reviews.text: This harness is fine if you use it for the car as advertised, but it's still weird securing it. The front hook for the leash is useless as it sits too low to the dog's belly even at it's highest point. Then it moves up and down anyway. All that ends up happening is your dog hops on 3 legs until the leash is underneath him and then the thing is pointless. Buy one of the regular ones that don't move for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Valenziano

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, love that it is tested, pretty ingenious, comes unlocked
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, love that it is tested. Still I wish that the strap was longer, so when the seat belt tightens - as they are supposed to do, it doesn't pin the dog to one small spot. In addition, I have found my dog not attached when I stop the car to get her out! As difficult as seat belts can be to lock, I think she just steps on the clip accidentally, and it unlocks! So much for safety!. But the harness is nice in its own right and the idea is pretty ingenious.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie C. Hipolit

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my dog is between sizes so I went with the larger size and even tightened all the way down, it’s still a little loose on her. The harness is of high quality construction and I like that it has the option of clipping in the front and back. Getting it on and off is a little more time consuming since I have to loosen and tighten the straps around her head each time (no buckle).
customer_reviews.author: Davis, S.

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I followed the size chart of their and both harnesses I ordered wouldn't fit either of my dogs. I ordered two mediums and for my smaller dog, it was too big; for my 46 lb dog (certainly within the 50lb range, it was way too small. AND, they charge almost $8.00 to return them - as a prime item. Not sure how that works but I won't be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: I love these harnesses
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth Kurgo harness I've purchased. The first one was for my former boyfriends lab. The second one was a gift for my son's dog and the last two for my rescue dog. One would have been enough, but my little rescue gained weight and I had to go back and get him a large. I love these harnesses. They seem comfortable on the pets and are very sturdy. I love the chest pad that makes them for comfortable. I like knowing my dog is secure in case of accident and have also used it on my current dog for walks as he pulls out of a collar faster than I can put it on him.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon W.

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I think the style and colors are great. I liked that it came as a set. I also appreciated the size chart for prepurchase purposes. My overall view is it is okay. There is a lot of movability of the leash on the back and it often slides back and forth on my dog's back. This has made it difficult to use during training times. Despite using the sizing chart, I just think it isn't fitted enough.
customer_reviews.author: Mg

customer_reviews.title: Not made like thy used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a second one in May, because the fastener button fell off my first one, making it loose enough for my dog to chew on and break. This one is only 3 months old and the snap that is not even being used, (as there are two for sizing) fell off today. I don’t have a crazy strong or rambunctious dog. My very first one years ago lasted forever but was the wrong size for my new dog. Poor construction. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A.

customer_reviews.title: Useful, comfortable, effective
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves to jump out of moving cars. Bought this and now clip her in my truck bed and she is happy as can be. Most importantly, she is safe. If we are going far (I live rural) then I'll use it as a seatbelt in the cab and it seems very safe. She can't get in my way and I think she'd be better off this way if we were hit. The harness is probably effective for leash trained dogs. It doesn't do squat for my rescue dog who had never been on a leash, but that is user error. She seems comfortable in it, at least! Love that there's a front and back place to clip.
customer_reviews.author: Kristan Marie

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy for my Westie
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something I could use to keep my little dog safe in the front passenger seat of my car. This is a very well made harness and looks like it would provide good protection in a car crash (heaven forbide). But it's hard to figure out and put on and then it was just too much weight for my 14 lb westie. Sadly, sent it back. Have decided to put her a properly installed crate in the back seat instead.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind for my pupper
customer_reviews.text: I hope I never get the chance to test this out but I travel often with my dog so I know my chances of getting in an accident with him were much higher. And even with my backseat dog hammock thing he could still fly through the window, so I got this. It seems very sturdy and durable, thick harness with metal buckle things in the connecting places. My dog isnt happy he can’t run around all over the back seat but he’s getting used to it (basically sleeps the whole way now) but even with it not super tight I don’t see any way for him to be ejected from the car in an accident.
customer_reviews.author: KyleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not as nice as the premium version of this harness
customer_reviews.text: Although it isn’t as nice as the more expensive version of this harness I am quite pleased. I purchased another brand before and my very large Great Dane outgrew it even though the claimed chest size was still within their parameters. Happy to say this harness fits with plenty of room for adjustment and holds very sturdy. The included seatbelt clip is perfect for attaching leashes to tables or your chair when hanging out on the patio at your favorite pup friendly location! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Josiah

customer_reviews.title: Safety first
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I feel so much better about my dogs riding in the car with this harness. The piece that sits on the dog's chest has a significant surface area which allows any force to be better distributed lessening the chance of injury. I bought a seat belt strap so that I can attach it to the harness so my doggo is securely buckled in. It was a little confusing at first how to undo the harness strap but once I figured it out, it was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Colin M.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work out.... sadly
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, my Lab was not a lover of this harness. Never could get him comfortable wearing it. He spent way too much time trying to put a front leg outside the harness (and succeeded too often no mater how tight it was). As can be seen in pic he clawed and chewed the front harness pad. With his strength I cannot afford the possibility it will break while on lead. So, this will be tossed into the "failure" box. Not a happy customer of the unit but sis like the ability to adjust the straps.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Actually used in an accident
customer_reviews.text: I got a medium for my corgi puppy. It fit him without adjusting anything. It was a little difficult to figure out how to put on and attach but I got it. Ended up getting in an accident the first time I used it on him, he didn’t slide off the seat after I hit the brakes. He was locked in and came out fine. The harness doesn’t allow for a lot of movement but I guess that’s the point. Glad I found this product.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth385

customer_reviews.title: Tough and versatile
customer_reviews.text: This Kurgo dog harness is very tough and extremely versatile. It has a large size adjustment range, which allowed us to get one for our puppy to grow into. We use it for walks, for car rides (dog seat belt), and it has a loop on the chest for a pull-deterring option. Not to mention it looks really nice. I definitely recommend the Kurgo dog harness.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Chill

customer_reviews.title: Feels sturdy
customer_reviews.text: What I like about this harness is that it's super adjustable! I adopted a large GSD mix and I don't pick him up until the end of the month. I was nervous on getting a harness early in case it didn't fit him. I feel comfortable buying this because it can really adjust if he was larger than I anticipated! Clips are smooth and aren't hard to buckle on.
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: So close to a 5 star
customer_reviews.text: The harness is well made, sturdy and easy to use. The only thing that keeps this from being a 5-star product is the snap which keeps the strap going around your dog's back centered. I have yet to get it to stay snapped even long enough to put the harness on my dog. It seems that velcro might have been a better idea or the use a high quality snap. That being said it does not really affect the usefulness of the harness as the only noticeable issue is that the back strap rotates side to side on the dog when walking, but will not come off.
customer_reviews.author: Comet Brower

customer_reviews.title: My Excellent Choice for a Harness
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Our 9mo anxious dog was not liking the Ruffwear harness we had for him but he’s okay with this one. This harness is a bit heavier because there’s less plastic except for the clips. Plus the additional feature of being able to belt him in a car seat is a very nice feature. I searched quite a bit online for a good harness and I’m very satisfied. My dog is lab/collie mix around 45-50 lbs and is wearing size Medium.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha D

customer_reviews.title: I like it. It prevents harsh choking, it’s easy to adjust, put on and take off. And my dog likes it!
customer_reviews.text: This product is working very well for my strong, 110 lbs Great Pyrenees. He seems to like putting on and taking off. And I haven’t seen any ill effects from daily usage. I like the design in that in cinches up on two side causing a “pull” in the middle of the collar strap and the body strap thereby resulting in less of a choking effect.
customer_reviews.author: MMA

customer_reviews.title: Dog Harness
customer_reviews.text: Not as well made as it looked. The leash clips are very light weight plastic, I have concerns about them breaking and letting the dog loose. The front leash clip is not very effective and when used causes the front of the harness to bunch. On a positive note, it appears to be comfortable for the dog when using the top leash clip.
customer_reviews.author: BOB2436

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I saw the reviews and went to cancel the order too late. We tried it and loved it because the straps are incrementally modifiable. My 51lb Great Pyrenees "Polar", is in the large. Her shape is not standard. I don't have to buy another one when she grows. I like the center of gravity ring and the car seat belt strap. The color blue is vibrant against her white fur. I will update if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Cavsome

customer_reviews.title: I was so excited to get this harness, but...
customer_reviews.text: It is not a good fit for my Pit Bull mixes... the harness slips and slides. I'd say it made a 20% difference in the pulling when we walk. I'd hoped it would be the miracle I was looking for. I love my littles, but geez I hate walking them. Maybe it was in the measuring.. could be my fault. I don't know. It wasn't worth my time to send this one back and get a different size only to find out that one wouldn't work either. The positive is the harness seems well made and it's held up fine, it just wasn't a good fit on my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: sinshady

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy harness
customer_reviews.text: This harness is very sturdy and I like the two options for clipping, however, I do feel that the chest part fits a little loose/awkward and am unable to really attach the leash there. I could not get a smaller size because then it would not fit over my dog's head. That being said, this is very sturdily made even with my 50lb dog that can pull hard at times and I like that the ring for the clip is metal. Also this does not seem to scratch his armpits like some other harnesses have because it is more narrow as it comes under his front paws.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: My dog lets me put it on him !
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a male chihuahua min pin mix and weighs 10 lbs. I have had problems with sizing because he has a wide chest. Usually for the right width the harness is too long but this fits right. I don't know why but this is the first harness I have not had a battle to put it on. Usually when he sees one he will runaway. With this one he will stand still and let me put it on.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa  Williams

customer_reviews.title: Best harness I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: My dog looves this harness. It is super easy to put on and take off. She is very neck sensitive when it comes to harnesses and collars but she enjoys this harness and doesn't cough or gag like she did with others. The customer service is also very good. All around a good purchase. For a size reference she is a German Shepherd/Husky mix and she is on the larger size of both breeds. She is 85lbs and wares a large.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: You need an advanced degree in mechanical engineering to work these buckles
customer_reviews.text: This was a Wirecutter recommendation that didn't work for me. This may be a great harness for irregular use in the car but, as a dog walking harness to use multiple times a day it's a nightmare unless you are leashing a dog that will hold still for extended periods. I was baffled by the buckle mechanism and had to try it without the dog first--finally figured it out, but then trying to do it actually on the dog was almost impossible. Sent it back after 1 day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: It is a great harness for walking, and for seatbelting into the car. It fits around the dog great. Using just a collar and leash is not a good idea. The dog can back up and get out of the collar. With the harness, this is less likely to happen. The dog will chew through the part that goes on the set belt, over time. I wish you could just buy that strap instead of the whole set.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Worst Harness Ever
customer_reviews.text: Only giving this one star because the short lead with the heavy duty carabiner is great. The Harness is the worst harness I have ever bought my Siberian Husky. “No Pull” dog harness? Seriously, this harness literally just twists and contorts itself before it even stays put.I have read every “tip” and seen every video there is of people using this harness and not one of their “tips” to use this harness applies to my dog. I have common sense and I Will NOT recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: ADocampo13

customer_reviews.title: Fits great, dog gets excited when I take it out to put in her
customer_reviews.text: This is the only harness that has ever fit my dog well. I was unsure of what size to get because she has a large rib cage but a medium sized neck. I went with the medium and it is perfect. Not too loose on neck, and there is still room to expand on the rib straps if needed. My dog moves around a lot in the car and tends to twist herself up in theseat belt but she has never slipped out of the harness. I don’t travel with her without this, even if it is just an in town trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High Quality with metal connectors and easy custom fit for your dog.
customer_reviews.text: Love this harness. Easy to put on and take off. I leave harness attached to car seat belt with D-Ring so just slide harness over dog's head and fasten side straps. Well-made without all metal connectors (no plastic clips to break). Easy to adjust for perfect fit. Update: I have been using this with my 25 pound Cavalier King Charles Spaniel for almost 2 years. Still looks new and my dog just waits expectedly for me to put harness on once up in car seat. He loves riding in car and I feel he is much safer having a doggy seat belt. I have air bag on passenger side disabled so if won't deploy with dog in the seat.
customer_reviews.author: VikingQueen

customer_reviews.title: The neck does not have enough adjustment to make a good fit, we purchase 3 different size for 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: First let me say that they appear to be quality made. My complaints are 1. The neck does not have enough adjustment to make a good fit, we purchase 3 different size for 3 completely different dogs and have the same problem with each. Also the neck has no clip release on it which makes it a chore to remove. 2. While walking our dogs from the front bottom hook, when you pull your dog to the side the harness slide around with it. It does however help a lot for dogs who like to pull hard. If it where not my two complaints I would have gladly given it a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: R. Berg

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, safe car harness
customer_reviews.text: A little difficult to figure out what goes where at first. The buckles are also not the easiest to conquer. But once you do figure out everything, it's smooth sailing from there. Sturdy harness, and the seatbelt tether is a nice addition too. Just hope it never has to actually come in handy. My dog was comfortable in the backseat in a lying down position. The secure position as recommended was too restrictive for him.
customer_reviews.author: Avimanyu Datta

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need
customer_reviews.text: I needed a car harness to keep my Aussie from smacking into the dashboard every time I made a sudden stop. This works perfectly. It’s easy to put on (I have the version with the click-in plastic buckles) and easy to connect to the car seat. It’s also easy to adjust and ended up becoming her walking harness as well. I really like the little handle on top that lets me hold onto her even if she’s not on a leash. Would recommend this to anyone looking for good harness. (Included a picture of the sizing chart since I couldn’t find that anywhere.)
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Badly proportioned for deep chested dogs
customer_reviews.text: Our Irish Setter weighs in at 58 lb (smallish for the breed). 16" neck, 32" deep chest. The large works for his chest - somewhere in the mid range of adjustment, but even when made its shortest the neck loop is so big I can fit my forearm through in addition to his neck. This is not proportioned for Setters and other deep chested, thin-necked dogs. When he leans into the chest pad with the leash attached to the back loop he seems comfortable, but if you attach to the front loop it all slips and slides and is pretty useless. Build quality and materials are good. The padding is not excessive, but helps to spread load.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Maeder

customer_reviews.title: Easy Fitting for the First time
customer_reviews.text: Overall the product seems be what it is advertised as. The jury is still out about the clips for the abdomen, the picture they appear to be flat and instead they are formed so I'm not sure of them. The first fitting was very simple especially compared to others which we have purchased in the past. I love the clip on the lower part for attachment of a leash for walking. I also purchased the black but wished they would have had more color choices.
customer_reviews.author: Southern by Heritage

product_meta.title: Kurgo Dog Harness | Pet Walking Harness | Car Harness for Dogs | Front D-Ring for No Pull Training | Includes Dog Seat Belt Tether | Tru-Fit Smart Harness | For Small, Medium, & Large Dogs
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Size:Medium| Style:Easy On & Off BucklesYou need something that is lightweight & easy to put on your dog because adventures happen every day. The Kurgo Tru-Fit Smart Harness with quick release buckles is the ideal starter everyday harness for your pet. With plastic easy on/off buckles, padded chest, & five adjustment points, it’s designed to keep your dog comfortable on your daily walk or run. Rear clip for normal walking, & front clip for no pull training. Also includes 10” dog car seat belt tether to attach to your car seat belt system. (Harness is not crash tested; seat belt tether is for restraint purposes only). The Tru-Fit Smart Harness comes in a range of colors and sizes. Cool for cats too.
feature_bullets: Everyday Dog Harness - Comfortable, lightweight walking harness with five easy adjustable points and plastic quick release buckles to make it easy to take on and take off when on the go. Suitable for walking or jogging.

No-Pull Training Clip - Pet harness has a front D-Ring to use as leash attachment to train dogs not to pull; It will turn them around when try to pull; Also features back leash ring for regular walking or jogging.

Includes Dog Seatbelt - Comes with dog seat Belt 10-inch tether that can be used during car travel as a pet seatbelt to restrain dog and prevent distracted driving: Or as a training tether. Harness is not crash tested.
Size and Fit - Size medium fits dogs with neck 16-25 inches and chest 18-28 inches; Neck is not adjustable for this harness; Please refer to Kurgo size chart
Committed to Quality - Product comes with hassle-free Kurgo lifetime warranty against manufacturer defects

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
